intro: Psychotria campyloneura, commonly known as the curly-stemmed psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its slender, twisting stems and small, dark green leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale green, with prominent yellow or orange stamens. Psychotria campyloneura is often found in shaded understory environments and is known for its ecological role in supporting local insect and bird populations.
